title: When someone plays very mechanical like
body:
What does that mean exactly?

I had someone say that to me the other game, I have play very mechanical or something.

Just wondering what they mean?

replies.body:
That literally doesn't mean anything, I've never heard that before, and I don't think it's an insult.
It may mean that the person is trying to tell you that you don't move around alot, maybe just stay in one place and hit?
I have no clue, never heard it before.

I don't move a lot, when there is no need to and I don't get that why players are ALWAYS moving around, like every, single, time they hit a minion they have to move and hit another minion and than... fucking move again, it shits me.

If there is no reason to move, no minion attacks, no enemy attacks, just fucking stand there like a tree, you will ensure you don't waste any valuable milliseconds with your "LOOK AT ME" shit and hit the most minions you can.

It all depends though, are you last hitting in lane with the enemy? Than yes, move around, go for a hit, move back and so forth. If you are alone and just farming mid game, SMASH THE LITTLE FUCKERS! You don't need to be fancy.
They probably want you to improve your mechanics. In League that's decision making and physical mechanics (combo speed, cs, reaction speed).

If he said they play very mechanical, wouldn't that mean he has good mechanics and not that he needs to improve them?
I'm not sure either tho

I thought being mechanical was a good thing?
E.G. Tumbling away from an enemies attack and then condemning them into a wall would be a mechanical Vayne play / shows you have understanding of her mechanics? (Very basic example, I could be so damn wrong)

Or maybe it means you move/act like a bot and are easily predictable?
I'm really not sure lol.
